(47) 20315^ July, 1947CABINETPROPOSAL TO CHARGE WAY-LEAVES FOR OIL PIPE-LINES INPALESTINEMemorandum by the Secretary of State for Foreign affairs should like to support the recommendation in the Colonial Secretary'sMemorandum (OP. (47) 198) that the right of the Palestine Government to makecharges for pipe-line facilities should be approved in principle.Palestine, whatever its future, will need revenue for economic development and I think that the oil companies who in the future obtain the right to laypipe-lines across Palestine should make a contribution to the revenues ofPalestine. Moreover, the other States through which new pipe-lines are to passpropose to charge for way-leaves and there therefore seems to be no reason whythe Government of Palestine should not do the same.E. B.Foreign Office, S. W. 1,15th-July, 1947.
